Were You Injured Because Of A Dangerous Power Tool Or Equipment?

When working with power tools at home or work, you likely take every precaution to ensure your safety and the safety of others.

However, even the most routine home repairs or on-the-job projects can result in serious injuries if the product you’re using has inherent defects or design flaws. Perhaps some of the safety features were missing or malfunctioning, and this led to a serious accident.

Manufacturers and construction companies must take proper care to ensure that their equipment remains in good working order. If they don’t and injuries happen, they could be liable under the law.

Helping Columbus Residents Recover For Dangerous Equipment Injuries For 50 Years

At Lamkin, Van Eman, Trimble & Dougherty, LLC, we have advocated for workers and consumers who have been injured by defective power tools and industrial equipment since 1968.

Our years of experience and track record of favorable outcomes for accident victims have taught us never to take an accident report at face value.

When we investigate workplace accidents at construction sites or in factories, we often find that defective equipment and dangerous tools were to blame. Sometimes, the problem was caused by another worker’s removal of a safety guard.

Whatever the case, we will take the appropriate steps to recover compensation from all negligent parties, whether the manufacturer, your employer or a third party.

Our experienced attorneys will get to the bottom of what happened and protect your right to full and fair compensation.

Common Dangerous Tools

Our experience includes representing industrial and construction workers as well as consumers and avid DIYers who have been injured by:

  • Power hand tools
  • Drills
  • Presses of any kind
  • Floor cleaners
  • Lawn mowers/tractors
  • Heavy machinery or equipment of any kind

Do Not Attempt This Alone — Contact Us For Help First. Free Consults.

Before speaking to an insurance adjuster or handling the situation on your own, talk to one of our attorneys to learn more about the law and potential legal recourse options available for your situation.

Schedule a free initial consultation with one of our Columbus lawyers today. Call 614-360-2706 or simply contact us online.

We serve clients throughout Ohio and collect attorneys’ fees only if we recover compensation for you.
